result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R. Halverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Jason R. Halverson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney.  Defendant Jason R. Halverson in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI received and reviewed.  Neither party wishes to address any errors or changes in the report.  Plea previously given/entered.  State gives argument for incarceration in the WSP.  Defense gives argument for probation.  Court orders:  Ct 1 - 5yrs WSP, 3 yrs IC and 2 yrs ES.  Ct 2 - 5 yrs WSP, 3 yrs IC and 2 yrs ES, cc.  Ct 3 - 90 days jail, cc.  Ct 4 - 6 mo jail, cc.  Ct 5 - 6 mo jail, cc.  Conditions:  AODA and follow through recommendations, absolute sobriety, supervision fees as required by DOC, costs (no cps), no contact with K.H., restitution TBD.  243 days credit.  Pleas currently given/entered.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.
*sent to Judge for review*
Sentencing hearing on October 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason R. Halverson in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney.  Defendant Jason R. Halverson in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation: Cts 1 - 5:  NC plea.  Request for PSI.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  NC plea given/accepted on Cts 1-5.    Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Order for PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
